intro: Lotononis newtonii, commonly known as Newton's lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
